result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra L. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to obtain/maintain full time employment in an occupation acceptable to agent.  May not quit employment without agent's approval.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription in own name and take as prescribed.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Not to associate with any known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

May not be present where illegal drugs are consumed or sold.

Sever all ties with the drug subculture.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Defendant to submit DNA sample; not required to pay DNA surcharge.

Obey all rules of agent and comply with any conditions and no contact orders of agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Defendant to pay restitution of $63.77 and restitution surcharge of $6.38.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time employment in an occupation acceptable to agent.

Complete AODA if agent orders.

No usage or possession of any controlled substances except those legally prescribed to defendant and take prescribed medications exactly as prescribed.

No drug paraphernalia.

Not be present at any place where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

No contact with any known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

Comply with any no contacts per agent.

Obtain and maintain housing that is deemed suitable by agent.

Comply with all other assessments, programming and rules ordered by agent.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Debra L. Anderson
